content:
e chest 
cavity between the lungs. It is responsible for supplying the body with oxygenated 
blood.  Each time the heart beats; it exerts a pressure on the veins and arteries. This is called blood pressure.  The heart is divided into four chambers – two on the right and two on the left. The right side gets blood from all parts of the body. 

9
This blood is unclean as it contains carbon dioxide. The heart pumps this blood 
to the lungs. Carbon dioxide passes from the blood into the air in the lungs and 
is breathed out. The blood takes in the oxygen from the air breathed into the 
lungs. The clean blood (containing oxygen) enters the left side of the heart and is pumped to all parts of the body.
A second important function of the circulatory system is to supply 
all the cells in the body with nutrients and energy. After food is digested in the stomach, it moves through the intestines, where nutrients from food are absorbed into the bloodstream.
